ملکی وے میں اربوں ستارے ہیں: How many stars are in the Milky Way? Number of stars in the Milky Way galaxy
Our best estimates tell us that the Milky Way is made up of approximately 100 billion stars. These stars form a large disk whose diameter is about 100,000 light years.
How many stars are in the Milky Way? Number of stars in the Milky Way galaxy

It is very difficult to count the number of stars in the Milky Way from our position inside the galaxy. Our best estimates tell us that the Milky Way is made up of approximately 100 billion stars. These stars form a large disk whose diameter is about 100,000 light years.

The evidences provided describe the Milky Way as having a diameter of approximately 100,000 light-years and containing billions of stars, which supports the claim that it is a vast galaxy. There is no evidence contradicting the statement that the Milky Way is vast.

Therefore, the statement in the text is consistent with the provided evidence.
